citation.article-title: Renibacterium salmoninarum gen. nov., sp. nov., the causative agent of bacterial kidney disease in salmonid fishes.

p.s: Renibacterium (Re.ni.bac.te'ri.um. L.n. renes the kidneys; Gr. neut. n. bakterion small rod; M.L. neut. n. Renibacterium kidney bacterium
Short rods, 0.3 to 1.0 by 1.0 to 1.5 μm, often occurring in pairs.
Temperature for optimum growth 15 to 18°C; slow growth occurs at 5 and 22°C; no growth occurs at 37°C.
The G+C content of the DNA is 53.0 mol%.
The cell wall composition is characterized by lysine as the diamino acid of the peptidoglycan.
The principal cell wall sugar is glucose.
Occurs among populations of salmonid fishes in North America, Europe, and Asia.
The type species is R. salmoninarum sp. nov.
